question: Access methods define how data is ________ from or ________ to a storage device.
In ________ access, data is read or written in a specific order, one after another.
An example of sequential access is a ________.
Direct access is also known as ________ access.
A ________ allows you to directly jump to the required data without reading everything before it.
Hard drives and SSDs use ________ access to retrieve files quickly.
Swapping is a memory management technique that moves processes between ________ and disk storage.
In swapping, inactive applications are moved to ________ when RAM gets full.
File allocation methods define how files are ________ on a disk.
In contiguous allocation, a file is stored in ________.
